doc.field: This file depicts the Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ) system developed as part of the 2010 Travel Behavior Inventory. It will be used for the Council's next generation of travel forecast models

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><eainfo><overview><eaover>Attributes
TAZ: TAZ number
CO_NAME: Name of the county
CO_NUM: Unique number for the county
TAD: TAD name (sequential in 7 county, census in ring)
CensusTAZ: 2010 US census TAZ number most closely matching this TAZ (census TAZs are larger, and boundaries do not always exactly match)
POPTOTAL: 2010 US Census population
HHTOTAL: 2010 US Census households
HUTOTAL: 2010 US Census housing units
POPINHH: 2010 US Census households
POPINGQ: 2010 US Census population in group quarters
MARKIDS: 2010 US Census married with children
UNMARRKIDS: 2010 US Census unmarried with children
FAMNOKIDS: 2010 US Census familes without children
NONFAMILY: 2010 US Census non-family households
WHITENH: 2010 US Census white non-hispanic
BLACKNH: 2010 US Census black non-hispanic
AMINDNH: 2010 US Census American Indian non-hispanic
ASIANNH:2010 US Census Asian non-hispanic
PACIFICNH: 2010 US Census Pacific Islander non-hispanic
OTHERNH: 2010 US Census Other non-hispanic
MULTRACNH: 2010 US Census multi-racial non-hispanic
HISPOP: 2010 US Census Hispanic population
OWNEROCC: 2010 US Census occupied housing
RENTEROCC: 2010 US Census occupied housing
VACANT: 2010 US Census vacant housing
POPOVER5: 2010 US Census population over 5
POPOVER16: 2010 US Census population over 16
POPOVER18: 2010 US Census population over 18
POPOVER65: 2010 US Census population over 65
HH_UNDER18: 2010 US Census households with members under 18
HH_65OVER: 2010 US Census households with members over 65
HHTYPE1: Family households with children, householder under 65
HHTYPE2: Family households with no children, householder under 65
HHTYPE3: Other householders that are not families and with more than one person
HHTYPE4: Householders with one person alone, householder under 65
HHTYPE5: Householders more than one person, 65 and older
HHTYPE6: Householders with one person alone, 65 and older
TOTAL_EMP: Total Employment (QCEW 2010, augmented with 2009 LED where nondiscloseable)
RETAIL_EMP: Retail Employment (QCEW 2010, augmented with 2009 LED where nondiscloseable)
NONRETAIL_: non-Retail Employment (QCEW 2010, augmented with 2009 LED where nondiscloseable)
</eaover></overview></eainfo><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Metropolitan Council</origin><title>2010 Transportation Analysis Zone(TAZ) System</title><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council</publish></pubinfo><pubdate>20120305</pubdate><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/TAZ2010.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This file depicts the Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ) system developed as part of the 2010 Travel Behavior Inventory. It will be used for the Council's next generation of travel forecast models</abstract><purpose>To show the boundaries of 2010 TAZs, aggregations, and household/employment data</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 county metropolitan area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><current>Data considered current through the date of this metadata. Household/population data from 2010 US decennial Census. Employment data from QCEW/LED data.</current><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20120305</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of this metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user.</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/TAZ2010</browsen></browse><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Jonathan Ehrlich</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Senior Planner</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>MN</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651.602.1408</cntvoice><cntemail>jonathan.ehrlich@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><distinfo><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.</distliab><stdorder><ordering>This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a map service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the "Services" link for this dataset in the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .</ordering></stdorder><distrib><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Jon Hoekenga</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>MN</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651.602.1561</cntvoice><cntemail>jonathan.hoekenga@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></distrib></distinfo><metainfo><metd>20120305</metd><metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn><metstdv>1.2</metstdv><metextns><onlink>http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/committee/standards/mgmg/metadata.htm</onlink></metextns><metc><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Jonathan Ehrlich</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Senior Planner</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>MN</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651.602.1408</cntvoice><cntemail>jonathan.ehrlich@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></metc></metainfo><dataqual><lineage><procstep><procdesc>Polygons were drawn based on transportation analysis needs, following natural and transportation boundaries, following FHWA TMIP guidance on TAZ boundary definition. In Minnesota, TAZs were created from scratch (Census TAZs were later created for submittal to the census based on these boundaries). In Wisconsin, definitions were initially based on submitted census TAZs and MnDOT Collar County TAZ files, but were extensively modified to serve transportation analysis needs</procdesc></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spref><horizsys><planar><gridsys><gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone>15</utmzone></utm></gridsys><planci><plandu>meters</plandu></planci></planar><geodetic><horizdn>NAD83</horizdn><ellips>GRS80</ellips></geodetic></horizsys></spref></metadata>
